p: In terms of where disease levels are highest, elevated incidence in rural areas is a common finding in many [ 16, 17] but not all studies [ 18]. In England and Wales the highest incidence is found in rural areas [ 7]. In Scotland this rural excess was only observed in the under 5Â s [ 19]. Strachan et al. [ 19] were able to attribute Campylobacter infections to different sources using Multilocus Sequence Typing. They argue that the major source of infection for young children in urban areas is chicken, whereas for rural children ruminant and other avian sources are of elevated importance.
